Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; glaze fired red-brown; interior glazed with added white rings; exterior: glazed; underside reserved with some white slip; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The number in Petrie's catalogue, '43', is written in pencil on the underside of the foot. For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 43)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1081) (phase 2)
